unnormalised: A 32-year-old male, identified as Mr. Rajesh Kumar, was admitted to AIIMS, New Delhi, at approximately 23:45 hrs on 14/07/2024 following a severe road traffic accident on NH-8. The patient presented with multiple traumas, including a suspected fracture of the femur and a Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS) score of 8.
normalised: A thirty two year old male, identified as Mister Rajesh Kumar, was admitted to A-I-I-M-S, New Delhi, at approximately twenty three forty five hours on fourteenth July two thousand and twenty four following a severe road traffic accident on N-H-eight. The patient presented with multiple traumas, including a suspected fracture of the femur and a Glasgow Coma Scale (G-C-S) score of eight.

unnormalised: Upon arrival, Dr. Anjali Mehta, the attending emergency physician, initiated Advanced Trauma Life Support (ATLS) protocols. Initial assessments revealed a BP of 90/60 mmHg and a heart rate of 120 bpm. Immediate interventions included securing the airway via intubation and administering 2 liters of Ringer's Lactate solution intravenously.
normalised: Upon arrival, Doctor Anjali Mehta, the attending emergency physician, initiated Advanced Trauma Life Support (A-T-L-S) protocols. Initial assessments revealed a B-P of ninety over sixty millimeters of mercury and a heart rate of one hundred and twenty beats per minute. Immediate interventions included securing the airway via intubation and administering two liters of Ringer's Lactate solution intravenously.

unnormalised: A rapid sequence of diagnostic tests, including a CT scan of the head and abdomen, was performed. Results indicated a subdural hematoma and internal bleeding. A surgical team led by Dr. Vikram Singh was immediately mobilized.
normalised: A rapid sequence of diagnostic tests, including a C-T scan of the head and abdomen, was performed. Results indicated a subdural hematoma and internal bleeding. A surgical team led by Doctor Vikram Singh was immediately mobilized.

unnormalised: The patient underwent an emergency craniotomy and laparotomy to address the hematoma and internal bleeding, respectively. Post-operative care included continuous monitoring in the ICU and administration of antibiotics, including Cefotaxime 1 gm q8h, to prevent infection. As of 15/07/2024, at 16:00 hrs, Mr. Kumar remains in critical but stable condition.
normalised: The patient underwent an emergency craniotomy and laparotomy to address the hematoma and internal bleeding, respectively. Post-operative care included continuous monitoring in the I-C-U and administration of antibiotics, including Cefotaxime one gram every eight hours, to prevent infection. As of fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four, at sixteen zero zero hours, Mister Kumar remains in critical but stable condition.

unnormalised: Further updates will be provided as the situation evolves. The hospital spokesperson emphasized the importance of road safety and adherence to traffic regulations to minimize such unfortunate incidents.
normalised: Further updates will be provided as the situation evolves. The hospital spokesperson emphasized the importance of road safety and adherence to traffic regulations to minimize such unfortunate incidents.
